page.title: 16Escrick Estate:the beginning
page.content: An early owner of Escrick Estate was Lord Knyvett,who in the 16th Century helped uncover the Gun Powder Plot.Sir Henry Thompson,a wealthy York merchant bought the estate in 1668,and the present owner,Mr. Forbes-Adam,is one of his descendants.The house has been subject to many alterations,but now only the cellars remain of the original house.John Carr was employed by Bielby Thompson in 1764 to redesign the wings and add a stable block.The grounds were extensive,and included a menagerie and a temple - now in ruins.The village of Escrick housed the workers,who ensured that the estate was run almost as a self- contained unit,which reached its heyday at the beginning of this century under the then owner Lord Wenlock,the baronetcy dying out in 1932.
